optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Chaos
entries: Whenever you roll a 1 on an attack roll you may choose to hit instead, but you also take the damage your attack dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Chaotic Failure
entries: Once per long rest when you roll a 1 with a d20 you can forgo gaining inspiration and instead roll on the {@table wild magic surge|<phb>} table. If the effect would result in you regaining all your sorcery points, you can instead regain the highest level spellslot you have spent or a hit die.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Chaos
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest in an area with a lot of Chromatic Orenth of a different element, you may choose to become the genasi associated with that element instead. Additionally once per Short Rest when a creature within 60 feet of you takes fire, lightning, poison, acid or cold damage you may use your reaction to deal an additional 2d4 damage to them. Both of the damage dice are of different elemental kinds of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Prismatic Breath
entries: Whenever you use your breath weapon, you may choose to deal any type of Elemental Damage.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Flame
entries: Whenever you crit on an attack roll you may deal an additional 2d6 fire damage to the target.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Spores
entries: Whenever you crit on an attack roll you may also deal 1d8 psychic damage to the target and any creature within 5 feet of them.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Poison
entries: When you deal poison damage you may also deal 1d4 psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Secret Detection
entries: You have advantage Insight ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Storm
entries: When you deal damage to a target it can’t take reactions until the start of its next turn. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom Modifier (minimum of once) and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Water
entries: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. If you have a swimming speed it increases by 15 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Wind
entries:
Whenever you hit a creature that is no more than 1 size larger than you with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you may choose to push it 15 feet in a horizontal direction of your choosing.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once) and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Smell of Fear
entries: You are aware of all creatures with the {@condition frightened} condition within 120 feet of you. You can't have disadvantage on attack rolls against them.

optionalfeature.name: Weatherman
entries: You may force a reroll of the weather. Additionally you are unaffected by conditions imposed due to extreme cold, wind or rain.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Wood
entries: Whenever you crit on an attack roll you may deal an additional 1d4 poison damage. For the next minute, at the start of every turn the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Chromatic save DC or take another 1d4 poison damage. On a success the effect ends.

optionalfeature.name: Endured Suffering
entries: When you cast a spell and a creature critically fails their saving throw with a duration, the length of the spell is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Chromatic Kobold maleability
entries:
Whenever you finish a short rest in an area where a chromatic dragons presence has an effect on the environment, you may choose to change one of your Chromatic Orenth traits to one connected to that dragon type. You cannot change this trait in this way.
Additionally you more easily blend in with other kobolds. You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Charisma (Deception) checks made to convince others that you are a different kind of kobold.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Chromatic Breath Weapons
entries: Your breath weapon deals 1d10 extra damage, and you may calculate the save DC using your Wisdom modifier instead of your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Connection
entries: You can telepathically communicate with any elemental within 30 feet of you. Additionally you have advantage on Charisma checks when communicating with them.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Fighting Adept
entries: When wielding a light weapon, you may choose to use your Wisdom in place of Strength of Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Spellcasting
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a spell, you may double your proficiency bonus for the attack roll or Spell Save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Mark of Tiamat
entries: Pick one of the following skills: Persuasion, Intimidation, Deception, Arcana, Nature or Religion. Whenever you make a check with this skill you can choose to use your Wisdom modifier instead of another ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Specific Resistance
entries: You are in touch with a specific type of magic allowing you to tap into how they work. Choose one of the schools of magic. You get advantage on saving throws against spells from that school of magic.

feature: The Ability to cast a spell from the chosen School

optionalfeature.name: Unnatural Limbs
entries: You gain an additional arm. You can grasp things with your arm, and you can use it as a snorkel. It has a reach of 5 feet, and it can lift a number of pounds equal to five times your Strength score. You can use it to do the following simple tasks: lift, drop, hold, push, or pull an object or a creature; open or close a door or a container; grapple someone; or make an unarmed strike. Your DM might allow other simple tasks to be added to that list of options. It can't wield weapons or shields or do anything that requires manual precision, such as using tools or magic items or performing the somatic components of a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Call of the Sun
entries: Whenever you hit a creature you may force them to make a Charisma saving throw (DC=8+your proficiency bonus+your Charisma modifier). On a failed save they gain the fiend creature type in addition to their normal creature type until they finish a long rest. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Summon the Sun
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a spell that creates bright light, the bright light counts as sunlight for the next hour.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Crits
entries:
Your mastery over your weapon grants you greater efficiency when perfectly striking your opponents. 
When you crit with a weapon that a Weapon Mastery Orenth trait applies to, your dice can explode, meaning when you roll maximum damage on a die you can roll an additional damage die of the same value. The amount of exploding dice rolled can technically be infinite, but after rolling an amount of exploding dice equal to your proficiency bonus you start taking the exploding damage yourself.

feature: An Orenth trait with the Weapon Mastery subtype.

optionalfeature.name: Unusual nature
entries: You don’t require food or drink.

optionalfeature.name: Physical Magic Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to magical bludgeoning/piercing/slashing damage. This resistance disappears until the end of your next turn whenever you take psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Elven Eyes
entries: You can see up to 1 mile away with no difficulty, able to discern even fine details as though looking at something no more than 100 feet away from you. Additionally the curvature of the planet you are on doesn’t interfere with your eyesight.

optionalfeature.name: Elven Suppleness
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet. You also do not leave footprints.

optionalfeature.name: Focused Expert
entries: When you pick this Orenth you lose proficiency with one skill and gain expertise in another one.

optionalfeature.name: Slow Death
entries: You cannot fail more than 1 death save per round of combat.

optionalfeature.name: The Elvenest Eyes
entries: Once per Long Rest you can ignore the maximum range of a ranged weapon you have, instead treating any creature you can see as being within range.

optionalfeature.name: Rage of the Small
entries: Your fury has turned into a rage. Your Fury of the Small damage increases to 2 times your Proficiency Bonus. In addition you can use it a number of times up to 2 times your Proficiency Bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Make em Gobble
entries: You learn to put your sharp teeth to good use. You get a bite attack which does 1d4+ Str piercing damage. In addition you also always add your Fury of the Small damage to this attack, but it is still limited to once per turn. This does not expend a use of Fury of the Small.

optionalfeature.name: Hoblin
entries: You have learned from your one syllable longer racial sibling. You are considered Hobgoblin and a Bugbear for the sake of Orenth prerequisites.

optionalfeature.name: Opportunity of the Small
entries: Your small size gives you a slight advantage against larger foes. In battle you can flank your opponent regardless of their size.

optionalfeature.name: Weird Magic
entries:
When a creature casts a spell within 60 feet of you, you may use your reaction to disturb the spell. Roll on the Weird magic table. The result of your roll applies to the spell cast.
You may use this trait once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Vampiric Strikes
entries: Whenever you hit with an unarmed strike you can gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. You may use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mind of the Fey
entries: You may use Wisdom or Intelligence for any Fey Orenth traits. Choose when you pick this trait.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a short rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Feywild
entries: The range of your darkvision increases by 30 feet. Additionally, while in darkness you can discern whether a creature currently has a magic effect on them. An arcana check may reveal the spell school at DMs discretion.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Blood
entries:
If you have the Fey Ancestry trait your creature type becomes fey. If your creature type is fey you gain the Fey Ancestry trait: 
You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Feywild Navigator
entries: Choose one of the following skills: Survival, Investigation, Perception, Stealth, or Nature. Whenever you make a check with this skill you can choose to use your Charisma modifier instead of another ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Novice Fey Bargainer
entries: Choose two of the following skills: Persuasion, Deception, Insight. You have advantage in one of these skills and disadvantage in another.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Gnome Tinkering
entries: When you use your Tinker trait you can also choose to make a machine that emulates any cantrip of your choice. You can activate this machine as an action (no matter the cantrip) while you are within 30 feet of it. The cantrip uses your Intelligence as its spellcasting ability.

optionalfeature.name: What do your gnomish eyes see?
entries: You gain 1 foot of True Sight.

optionalfeature.name: Sapphire Weapon Training
entries: Your connection to sapphire dragons provides you with the power to hone your skills with a weapon. Pick one martial weapon, you get proficiency with this weapon and your Gem traits count as Ingens Orenth traits for the purpose of gaining access to higher tier Orenth traits.

optionalfeature.name: Intuitive Gravity
entries: As a reaction to seeing a drop that would result in fall damage, you may roll the damage this fall would cause. Your character knows the value of this roll. Anything that would subsequently take this damage will use your damage roll instead of rolling for themselves.

optionalfeature.name: Subtle Magic Adept
entries: You've adapted the quiet casting of an Emerald Dragon. When you cast a cantrip you can choose to ignore verbal and somatic components. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier. You regain all uses on a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Who is who
entries: Once per long rest when you use your breath weapon you may apply an addition effect to it. Any creature that took damage from your breath gets the spell Disguise Self cast upon them as if you had cast the spell, making them look like you. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you lose concentration.

optionalfeature.name: Illusory Core
entries: This trait counts as an orenth trait of any type. Additionally you can make your other orenth abilities look like a different type using illusions.

optionalfeature.name: Emerald Fire
entries: Once per turn when you deal fire damage, you may also deal an additional 1d4 psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mental Prowess Estimation
entries:
As a bonus action you can observe the behaviour of a creature to get a sense of their mental state. Make an Intelligence (Insight) check against their Charisma score. On a success you learn which of their mental ability scores is the highest and which is the lowest, and whether they have proficiency in any mental saving throws.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: I'm pretty sure you're willing
entries: You may target an unwilling creature with a spell that requires a willing creature. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8+your prof. bonus + your Intelligence modifier), on a failure, the spell is cast upon them and you may not use this feature again until you finish a long rest. On a success, you spend the spellslot but nothing happens.

optionalfeature.name: Connected to your Ancestry
entries: You gain a tier 1 trait from the Orenth type related to your original race.

optionalfeature.name: How did I die from that last time?
entries: Pick a non-physical damage type. You gain resistance to this damage.

optionalfeature.name: Undead Skill
entries: Pick one of the following skills: Athletics, Medicine, History, Arcana, Religion, Nature. You gain proficiency in the skill and you can use Constitution instead of the normal ability whenever you make a skill check.

optionalfeature.name: Send them to Sardior
entries:
Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points you may choose to have one of the following things happen, depending on the creature's alignment. You may choose which alignment if the creature has multiple, such as Chaotic Good. 
Good: Any creature of your choice within 15 feet of the creature that died gains temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier. 
Evil: Any creature of your choice within 15 feet of the creature that died takes necrotic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. 
Neutral: A creature of your choice within 30 feet of the creature that died can cast a cantrip with a casting time of one action, as a reaction. 
Chaotic: A creature of your choice within 30 feet of the creature that must immediately use its reaction to make a melee attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. 
Unaligned: A familiar appears in the dead creature's space as if you had cast find familiar. The familiar is undead and remains for 10 minutes. 
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest. After the effect ends the soul of the creature safely passes to Sardior.

optionalfeature.name: Orenth Sense
entries: As a bonus action you can sense what Orenth type a creature is most aligned to and what Orenth traits they have.

optionalfeature.name: Post Mortem Estimator
entries: As an action you can somewhat accurately determine the time that has passed since a creature has died, rounded to an amount of time the DM thinks sounds right at the time. For example, 134 years dead would give you an estimate of 100 years, 25 seconds dead would give you an estimation of 30 seconds dead.

optionalfeature.name: Increased Entropy
entries: Whenever you take fire damage your speed increases by 15 feet until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Play Dead
entries: Once per long rest you may cast Feign Death on yourself a reaction to taking damage.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Life
entries: While taking a short rest you may take the hit dice of a willing creature who is also taking a short rest and roll them to regain your own hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Reach
entries: At the start of your turn you can choose to telekinetically fling your weapon across the battlefield. Until the end of your turn your reach becomes 30 feet. You may use this trait a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Projectiles
entries: Once per turn when you hit with a ranged weapon or spell attack you may choose to pull the creature 10 feet towards you. You may do this a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sapping Strikes
entries: Choose a melee weapon that has no properties that you have proficiency with. Whenever you hit a creature with this weapon, it is unable to regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Telekinetic Weapon
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature that is no more than 1 size larger than you with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you may choose to push it 15 feet in a horizontal direction of your choosing. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier, and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gem Kobold maleability
entries:
Whenever you finish a short rest in an area where a gem dragons presence has an effect on the environment, you may choose to change one of your Gem Orenth traits to one connected to that dragon type. You cannot change this trait in this way.
Additionally you more easily blend in with other kobolds. You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Charisma (Deception) checks made to convince others that you are a different kind of kobold.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Gem Breath Weapons
entries: Your breath weapon deals 1d10 extra damage, and you may calculate the save DC using your Intelligence modifier instead of your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Gem Shell Defense
entries: You gain resistance to one of the following damage types (choose when you pick this trait): necrotic, psychic, force, thunder or radiant.

optionalfeature.name: Telepathic Link
entries: As an action, you can psionically link yourself to a willing creature you share a language with. For the next hour, you can mentally communicate with them as long as you are on the same plane of existence. You may use this feature once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Information Gatherer
entries: Pick one of the following skills: Stealth, Medicine, Insight, Perception, Crafting or Persuasion. Whenever you make a check with this skill you can choose to use your Intelligence modifier instead of another ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Fighting Adept
entries: When wielding a light weapon, you may choose to use your Intelligence in place of Strength of Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Spellcasting
entries: Once per long rest you may change the saving throw of a spell you cast to an Intelligence saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Cooling Ears
entries: Because of your big ears you are able to cool off quickly, giving you resistance to fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Partial Retraction
entries: You can partially retract yourself into your shell, which will still allow you to move at half your speed.

optionalfeature.name: Giant's Heritage
entries: The strength of the giants flows within you. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. You have can also easily acclimate to cold climates and heights.

optionalfeature.name: Craft of the Giants
entries:
Your connection to giants grants you the power to forge and create. Depending on the type of Giant you are connected to you choose one proficiency in an associated tool. If you already have proficiency with this tool your Proficiency Bonus is doubled. 

Fire: Smith’s Tools
Cloud: Gaming Set
Frost: Cobbler’s Tools, Leatherworker’s Tools
Stone: Mason’s Tools 
Hill: Cook’s Utensils
Storm: Navigator’s Tools, Cartographer’s Tools, Water Vehicles

optionalfeature.name: Sturdiness of the Earth
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being pushed or knocked prone, and only get moved half the distance when forcefully moved against your will.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Sprinters
entries: You gain the ability to sprint across the battlefield. Whenever you dash you may choose to move with extreme speed, this also uses up your regular movement. You move three times your movement speed, but the movement must be in a straight line and unobstructed by difficult terrain. While dashing in this way opportunity attacks against you have advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Touched by the Waves
entries: You can give a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus the ability to breathe underwater, including you. You may change these creatures after every short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Octopus Camouflage
entries: After you spend a long rest in a town you can choose to resemble the local race.

optionalfeature.name: Fearsome Accuracy
entries: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with and that has the Thrown property. As an attack, you may throw your weapon at a creature at the very limit of your range. Make an attack roll against a creature exactly the maximum distance of your range away. If the attack hits, the creature takes normal damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8+your proficiency bonus + the ability score you used for the attack). On a failure, the creature becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. They may repeat the saving throw at the end of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Deflective Weapons
entries: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that you can dual-wield. While dual-wielding with this weapon you may use a reaction after being attacked to roll a d4 and add the result to your Armor Class until the end of the attacker’s turn.

optionalfeature.name: Grinding Halt
entries: Choose a melee weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Heavy or Reach property. Whenever you must make a saving throw to avoid being moved against your will, you can dig your weapon into the ground as a reaction. Roll 2d6 and add the number rolled to the saving throw. If the effect pushing you does not have a saving throw, you move 5 feet fewer.

optionalfeature.name: Applicable Weapon Mastery
entries: After you finish a long rest you may apply any Weapon Mastery Orenth trait to a different weapon that meets the requirements.

optionalfeature.name: Spellcasting Weapons
entries: You can choose one weapon you are proficient with and use it as a spellcasting focus.

optionalfeature.name: Blowgun Expert
entries: Whenever you use a blowgun it deals 1d4 + your Dexterity modifier amount of piercing damage. Additionally it gains the Light property.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Tosser
entries: Choose a weapon you have proficiency with, with the Thrown property. The normal and long distances you can throw this weapon doubles.

optionalfeature.name: What do you mean magic?
entries: Whenever you deal damage that triggered due to you hitting with a weapon attack, you can make the damage type the same as your weapon damage.

optionalfeature.name: Crushing Blow
entries: Choose a melee weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Heavy property. As an action you can make a single weapon attack with this weapon, on a hit the target's AC is reduced by 1 until it finishes a Short Rest. Its AC can't be reduced below 10+its Dexterity modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Mixed Ancestry
entries: You gain access to all Orenth types and this trait counts as a Tier 1 trait for any type.

optionalfeature.name: The Human Spirit
entries: Your human spirit grants you hope unlike any other. After you finish a long rest you get a point of inspiration.

optionalfeature.name: Stubborn
entries: You know what you like and don’t need anything else. You gain the ability to pick the same Orenth trait twice.

optionalfeature.name: Homing Minotaur
entries: You know where you come from, and more importantly how to get back. Once per long rest you can select a point or object you can see within 30 feet. Until you use this feature again you can always find your way back to this point or object.

optionalfeature.name: Continued Assault
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a weapon attack you can mark it. The next creature that damages the creature you marked takes extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus and regain all uses after a long rest. If you make a critical hit you do not need to expend a use.

optionalfeature.name: Mirage Resistance
entries: Travelling as a nomad through the desert has left you especially well equipped against the illusions of the desert and its dragons. You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made against illusion spells.

optionalfeature.name: Tiny Sneaky Steps
entries: You can hide while travelling at a normal and slow pace, and do an activity at the same time.

optionalfeature.name: Brass Magic Initiate
entries: You learn the message cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Cacti Gatherer
entries: Whenever you take piercing damage, you may subtract your proficiency bonus from the damage.

optionalfeature.name: Clouds of Shade
entries: As an action, while travelling outside you are able to create a number of small magical clouds equal to your proficiency bonus and assign each of these clouds to a creature of your choice. These creatures have advantage on saving throws against Extreme Heat, as well as saving throws made to avoid taking fire and lightning damage. You can dismiss the clouds at will.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Item Conversations
entries: You are able to distinguish the emotional state of any magic item and make a Wisdom (Insight) check to determine what may have caused this emotional state. The DC is determined by the DM and depends on the power of the magic item.

optionalfeature.name: Sleep Breath Resistance
entries: Magic cannot put you to sleep. Additionally you can cast the sleep spell once per long rest, using your Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

optionalfeature.name: Innate Knowledge
entries: You can learn about the history of a place simply by staying within the area for an hour. You may attempt to make history checks about a location without having any prior knowledge about it.

optionalfeature.name: Bronze Magic Initiate
entries: You learn the resistance cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Funne man
entries: Whenever you make a pun you can give a creature that laughed temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses after a Long Rest. You can still make puns even if you have no more uses remaining.

optionalfeature.name: Copper Magic Initiate
entries: You learn the guidance cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Skill
entries: After a long rest you may choose to one of your skill or tool proficiencies and a creature of your choice that you can see. This creature gains that skill proficiency until you designate it or another creature a skill.

optionalfeature.name: Gold Magic Initiate
entries: You learn the light cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

optionalfeature.name: I am the Light
entries: Whenever you are blinded, darkness spreads around you. While the condition lasts you have the Darkness spell cast centered on you. If the spell is dispelled you are no longer blinded.

optionalfeature.name: Silver Magic Initiate
entries: You learn the prestidigitaiton cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

optionalfeature.name: Silver Spellcasting
entries: When you cast a beneficial spell on an ally you may also give them a number of temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses at the end of Long Rest.

optionalfeature.name: Metallic Kobold Maleability
entries:
Whenever you finish a short rest in an area where a metallic dragons presence has an effect on the environment, you may choose to change one of your Metallic Orenth traits to one connected to that dragon type. You cannot change this trait in this way.
Additionally you more easily blend in with other kobolds. You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Charisma (Deception) checks made to convince others that you are a different kind of kobold.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Metallic Breath Weapons
entries: Your breath weapon deals 1d10 extra damage, and you may calculate the save DC using your Charisma modifier instead of your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Metallic Fighting Adept
entries: When wielding a light weapon, you may choose to use your Charisma in place of Strength of Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Humanoid Guide
entries: Choose one of the following skills: Crafting, Arcana, Religion, History, Medicine or Nature. Whenever you make a check with this skill you can choose to use your Charisma modifier instead of another ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial Blood
entries: Your creature type becomes Celestial and when you cast the light cantrip you can have two lights active.

optionalfeature.name: Hands of Greater Healing
entries: You may roll d6s instead of d4s whenever you use your Healing Hands ability.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Celestial Revelation
entries:
You gain the following benefit, depending on your chosen revelation: 
Necrotic Shroud: You can frighten creatures up to 20 feet away and you may deal radiant damage instead of necrotic damage. 
Radiant Consumption: The aura’s size increases to 20 feet and you can choose to exclude a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier, who won’t take the damage. 
Radiant Soul: Your flying speed increases by 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: True Helper
entries: You can take the help action even if you have no proficiency in the skill or tool.

optionalfeature.name: Merciful Warrior
entries: Any damage you deal can be non-lethal. Additionally you have advantage on Wisdom (Medicine) checks to stabilize a creature.

optionalfeature.name: Trench Coat
entries: You have (or find) a buddy on whose shoulders you stand and together you pass as a larger humanoid. You gain the following benefits: You have advantage on saving throws made against being charmed; You have disadvantage on saving throws made to avoid being knocked prone; You gain additional hit points equal to your level; When you drop to 0 hit points your buddy dies instead of you and you revert back to your untrenchcoated form. You lose this trait and can pick a different trait that you apply for.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Casting
entries: Choose a spell that you can cast with a casting time of an Action. Once per Long Rest you may cast this spell as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Mastered Teleportation
entries: Choose a spell that allows you to teleport. Whenever you cast this spell you may double the distance you can teleport with it.

optionalfeature.name: Equinox
entries: Around the equinoxes, the days and nights are balanced and last equally long. Whenever you fail a d20 check you made with disadvantage, you may add 1d4 to your next d20 check.

optionalfeature.name: Painting Eggs
entries: You gain proficiency with Painters Supplies. Additionally, over the course of a short rest you can paint eggs with a pretty pattern and give them to your friends. As a reaction to failing a d20 during the next day they made look at the egg and roll 1d4 and add it to the check, possibly turning it into a success. You can make a number of eggs equal to your Wisdom modifier every short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Rope Capture
entries:
On your turn you may use 15 feet of rope to wrap a creature up. You must use your movement to fully loop around the creature, ending the movement in the place you started. You can then use your bonus action to try and tighten the rope and restrain the creature. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Dexterity modifier. The target succeeds automatically if it’s Huge or larger. On a failed save, the target has the Restrained condition until it unentangles itself. To escape, the target must use its action to make a DC 10 Strength (Athletics) check, escaping on a success.
A creature within 5 feet of the target can use its action to attempt the same thing. Destroying the rope (AC 10; 5 HP; immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage) also frees the target, ending the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Chug! Chug! Chug!
entries: You can drink a healing potion as a bonus action and still restore all the maximum amount of hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Channel the Weather
entries:
Once per turn when you hit with a weapon attack while outside, you may apply one of the following benefits, depending on the current weather: 
Heat: Your attack deals an additional 1d6 fire damage
Cold: Your attacks deal an additional 1d6 cold damage
Wind: After hitting with a weapon attack you may immediately move 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. This movement doesn't cost you any movement. 
Rain: Your attacks deal an additional 1d6 acid damage. 
Storm: At the start of the day pick either the Wind or Rain benefit.

optionalfeature.name: Harvest of the Land
entries: When performing the Foraging travelling activity and you find enough food for your party, you can give your party an additional benefit in addition to a full stomach. Anyone that eats from the food you find may add your Wisdom modifier to one of the hit dice they roll to regain hitpoints.

optionalfeature.name: Amethyst Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled transmutation spell you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Crystal Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled divination spell you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Jade Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled enchantment spell you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Emerald Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled illusion spell you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Sapphire Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled abjuration spell you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Topaz Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled necromancy spell you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Absorbant Recovery
entries: Once per short rest when you take damage that you are resistant to you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Pious Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you gain piety you may also regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Life Absorption
entries: Once per long rest when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell you cast, you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Trans Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you may spend 8 hours trancing during a short rest and regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Unlucky Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you roll a natural 1 on a d20 check you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: No Energy Wasted
entries: Once per long rest when a creature succeeds on a saving throw against a spell you cast resulting in nothing happening, you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Recovery in a Moment of Peace
entries: Once per long rest when you get grappled, restrained, stunned, exhausted, charmed, frightened, slowed, dazed or paralyzed against your will you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Mind and Body Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you regain hit points from a levelled spell you also regain a first level spell.

optionalfeature.name: Feywild Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you teleport you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Recovery from beyond the Grave
entries: Once per short rest when you are reduced to 0 hit points you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Gish Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you crit with a weapon attack you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Tinkerer's Recovery
entries: Over the course of a long rest your may imbue an item with the arcane energy. Before you next long rest you may unleash the energy inside the item as a bonus action to regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Ritual Recovery
entries: Once per long rest you may perform a 10 minute ritual to enhance your power. At the end of the ritual one of your first level spellslots becomes one level higher.

optionalfeature.name: Recovery of the Breath
entries: Once per long rest when you use your Breath Weapon you may regain a first level spellslot. The orenth type of this trait depends on the type of dragonborn you are.

optionalfeature.name: Mind over Body Recovery
entries: Once per long rest during a short rest when you regain hitpoints from rolling hit dice you may refrain from adding your constitution modifier to the roll and regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Extraplanar Recovery
entries: Once per short rest when you or a party member reduces an abberation, fiend or fey to 0 hit points you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Lunar Recovery
entries: Once per short rest when you or a party member reduce an elemental, undead, celestial or dragon to 0 hit points you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Recovery from Nature
entries: Once per short rest when you or a party member reduce a plant, beast or ooze to 0 hit points you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Murderous Recovery
entries: Once per short rest when you or a party member reduce a humanoid or giant to 0 hit points, you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemical Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you consume a potion you may also regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Wilderness Recovery
entries: Once per long rest while travelling you may forgo choosing a travelling activity and instead spend the day focusing on your arcane energy, regaining a first level spellslot at the end of the day.

optionalfeature.name: Overcharged Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you upcast a spell you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Ancestral Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a racial or orenth spell you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Chaos Rest
entries: Whenever you take a short rest, roll thrice on the Choas Rest table. Each of the regional effects occur around you while you rest.

optionalfeature.name: Fivehead
entries: 5 times per Long Rest when you fail a saving throw you may add 1d4 to the roll, possibly turning it into a success.

optionalfeature.name: Chaotic Spellcasting
entries: Instead of casting a specific spell you can also choose to roll a die. Pick a spell level and count how many spells of that level you have prepared that take an action to cast. Roll a die with that many faces and the spell that it lands on gets cast. The spell is cast as if it was cast with a spellslot level one higher than the one used.

optionalfeature.name: Dyslectik Spellcasting
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a spell, you may change one letter of the spell, and the effect accordingly. The power of the spell remains approximately the same.

optionalfeature.name: Chromatic Snack Summoner
entries:
Once per long rest you can cast Summon Beast at a level equal to your proficiency bonus. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell. The type of beast it summons depends on the Chromatic type you associate with as seen in the Snack Summon table
When you cast the spell in this way it requires no components. If you kill the beast you regain a number of hit points equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus. Once you attack the beast it is no longer an ally and will fight back, but won’t run. 
You may also cast the spell in the regular way with any spell slots you have yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Elemental Spellcasting
entries: Depending on your subrace you gain access to additional spells. You may cast these spells once per long rest and you use the same spellcasting ability as your other racial spells. You can also cast them with any spell slots of the appropriate level. If you have the Elemental Chaos or Mark of Tiamat Orenth Trait you may also choose the Chaos option. Improved Elemental Spells

optionalfeature.name: Power from Wealth
entries: For every 500 gp in gold coins you have on you (that is part of your personal wealth and not shared with anyone) during a long rest your current and maximum hit points increase by 1 to a maximum of twice your original maximum hp. This benefit lasts until the end of your next long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Fire born of the Sun
entries: You may pick a tier 3 Cosmic (Sun) Orenth trait. Additionally this trait counts as a tier 3 Cosmic Orenth trait for the purpose of gaining access to further orenth traits.

optionalfeature.name: Conductivity
entries: As an action point towards a willing creature within 100 feet of you that has a Lightning Orenth trait. You cast Lightning Bolt in their direction, using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability, but the spell ends at their location and they aren't affected. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Acidous Weakness
entries: Whenever you take slashing damage you may deal acid damage equal to twice your level to any creature of your choice within 10 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Merciless Strikes
entries: Whenever you hit a prone, unconscious or paralyzed creature with a weapon attack, you may deal additional fire damage to them equal to your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Flying Charge
entries: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Reach property. For every 10 feet you move straight toward a creature before hitting it with an attack with this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 damage.

optionalfeature.name: Frozen Winds
entries: Twice per turn when you push a creature you may deal 1d4 cold damage to the creature for every 10 feet you push them

optionalfeature.name: Relentless
entries: Whenever you hit with a weapon attack you may choose to make an additional attack. You can keep making additional attacks until you miss with an attack roll, but each attack gets a cumulative -2 penalty to the attack roll. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Flyby
entries: When you make a melee attack against a creature while flying, you don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Spellcasting
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that deals elemental damage you can choose to change the damage type to the damage type associated with your previous orenth trait. Whenever you cast a spell that deals the same damage as your previously chosen orenth trait you may deal an additional 1d6 damage of that type.

feature: A tier 2 fire, lightning, wood, water or cold orenth trait

optionalfeature.name: Chromatic Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to fire, lightning, poison, acid or cold damage. Additionally, once on your turn you may deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus when you hit with an attack roll. The type of damage is the same as the one you have resistance to.

optionalfeature.name: Jumping Spark
entries: You gain the benefits of the Cleave Orenth trait. Before you make the second attack you may move 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks or using your movement. You must end this movement in a place where you can reach your second target.

optionalfeature.name: Jumping Lightning
entries: You may move up to 15 feet whenever you use your Jumping Charge ability. Additionally, whenever you cleave attack hits you may move again and strike a different target.

optionalfeature.name: Synced Spellcasting
entries: When a creature casts a spell within 60 feet of you that you have prepared, you can use your reaction to expend a spell slot to cast the same spell. The spell slot must be of the same or lower level as the triggering spell.

optionalfeature.name: Interrupted Teleport
entries: As a reaction to a creature teleporting within 60 feet of you can make an opposed Intelligence (Arcana) check against the teleporter. On a success you interrupt their teleport, causing them to only travel half the distance they intended to and taking 1d6 force damage for every 10 feet they intended to teleport (to a maximum number of dice equal to your level). On a success, they teleport successfully and only take half damage. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Doom
entries: When you deal damage to a creature you can Doom them. While they are Doomed they take an additional 1d4 damage whenever they take damage. You may use this feature once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Swarm in disguise
entries: You can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and you can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. You become resistant to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage. However, whenever you regain hit points or gain temporary hit points you only get half.

optionalfeature.name: Horrific Jaw
entries: You unhinge your jaw and attempt to swallow a creature whole. When you hit a creature of equal or smaller size than you with a bite attack, you may attempt to swallow it whole. It must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8+ your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failure, it gets swallowed into a pocket dimension, which it can attempt to escape at the end of each of its turns by repeating the saving throw, if it succeeds on a consequent turn it appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet you. On a success, nothing happens. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

feature: Ability to make a Bite attack

optionalfeature.name: Incomprehendable Mind
entries: You become immune to psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Demiplanar Stomach
entries: Your mouth functions as a bag of holding.

optionalfeature.name: Heat Stroke
entries: As an action you can channel the exhaustive heat of the sun. For the next minute any creature of your choice that starts its turn within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8+your Proficiency Bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failure they gain a exhaustion levels equal to your proficiency bonus that while they are within 10 feet of you and your aura remains. On a success they become immune to the effect for the next hour. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Touch
entries: Once per turn when you hit with an unarmed strike you may deal fire damage to the creature equal to your Proficiency bonus. Additionally whenever a creature starts its turn being grappled they also take fire damage equal to your Proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Burned Memories of the Amnizu
entries: Once per long rest you may cast Modify Memory using Charisma as your spellcasting ability. On a successful save the creature takes fire damage equal to twice your level.

optionalfeature.name: Little sustenance needed
entries: You can drink from a potion twice and get the full effect both times. Additionally you only need to drink and eat half as much.

optionalfeature.name: Shroud of the Wilderness
entries: While you are in an area that is lightly obscured, you can Hide as a bonus action even if you are being directly observed.

optionalfeature.name: Goblin Magic
entries: You are in tune with your Fey ancestry. You learn the Prestidigitation cantrip. In addition, once per turn when you hit a creature with a spell attack you can do 2d6 extra damage if an ally is within 5 feet of the target.

optionalfeature.name: Efficiency of the Small
entries: You have become efficient with managing your movements in battle. As a bonus action you can select two options from your Nimble Escape feature at the same time. If you have the Cunning Action feature you can also pick one of those options.

optionalfeature.name: Goblin Ferocity
entries: Your feral nature allows you to move faster. As a bonus action you can move up to your speed to a target. If you move 30 feet in a straight line you are allowed to make a weapon attack or unarmed strike as part of the Bonus Action. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses after you finish a Long Rest.

optionalfeature.name: Faster than your Shadow
entries: You may make an opportunity attack against a creature moved forcefully.

optionalfeature.name: Opportunity of Many
entries: Choose a weapon you are proficient with that has the Two-Handed property. While flanking an opponent you get advantage on the attack roll when wielding this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Master Fey Bargainer
entries: Whenever you roll with advantage you roll three dice and take the highest one. Whenever you roll with disadvantage you roll three dice and the lowest one.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Fey Steps
entries: You have become more adept at using your Fey Steps casually. When you use your bonus action for Fey Steps you don’t provoke attacks of opportunity.

optionalfeature.name: Anti Parallel Timelines
entries: Once per long rest as a reaction to taking damage you take no damage and gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt instead.

optionalfeature.name: Illusory Duplicates
entries: At the start of your turn you may choose to create an illusory duplicate of yourself. Both versions of you can move up to your movement speed, but you share your action and bonus action. If you have the Extra Attack ability you can split the extra attack(s) between your two versions. At the end of your turn you decide which one is the real you and the duplicate dissapears. Both versions of you share the same hp pool, so whenever one takes damage the other takes the same damage.

optionalfeature.name: Ruby Rest
entries: Whenever you take a short rest you may choose two Gem Rest Orenth effects that remain active during your rest.

optionalfeature.name: Spooky Ghost Boy
entries: Once per long rest you get a flying speed equal to your walking speed for the next minute, you can hover and you can move through creatures but not end your turn inside of them.

optionalfeature.name: Old habits didn't die
entries: Whenever you make an ability check have proficiency with you may choose to not roll and take 10 instead. You may do this a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a Long Rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sent with a mission from Sardior
entries: You are so focused on your task given to you by Sardior you can't be distracted easily. You have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration and saving throws to avoid being charmed.

optionalfeature.name: Dragonborn of Sardior
entries: You count as every type of gem dragonborn for the sake of Orenth Prerequisites, and you do not need to meet any Sardior piety prerequisite. Additionally, you may pick a tier 2 Orenth trait

optionalfeature.name: Echolocation
entries: You have blindsight out to 30 feet while you aren't deafened. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

optionalfeature.name: Shell Shock
entries: Whenever you deal thunder damage to a creature you may force them to make a Constitution saving throw (DC=8+your your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a a failure they lose any bonus they had to their armour class due to natural armour until the end of your next turn. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after you finish a Long Rest

optionalfeature.name: Temporary Resurrection
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points you may use your reaction to keep its corpse under your temporary control. The creature regains 1 hit point and becomes charmed by you until the end of your next turn. While charmed you can give it commands that it must obey (no action from you required). You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Drain its life
entries: You gain the benefits of the Sap Orenth trait. After you use your Sap Orenth trait the creature only deals half damage on the next attack that hits.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Cleave
entries: You get the benefits of the Cleave Orenth trait. Additionally, wheneveryou make the second attack, the second creature must be within 10 feet of the original but not necessarilily within your reach.

optionalfeature.name: Transfer of Kinetic Energy
entries: You gain the benefits of the Slow Orenth trait. Additionally, whenever you reduce a creature's speed your own speed increases by 10 feet until the end of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Elegant Fighting
entries: Pick one weapon that you have proficiency with that lacks the Finesse trait. This weapon is now considered a Finesse weapon when you wield it.

optionalfeature.name: Mastery over Body and Mind
entries: You gain the benefits of the Elegant Fighting Orenth trait. Additionally, you may use your Intelligence instead of your Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls when fighting with a Finesse weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Cosmic Orenth Transmuter
entries: As an action you can touch an aberration or fiend that has been killed within the last minute. It must have a minimum CR of 7. Over the course of the next hour the Cosmic Orenth of the creature is captured inside a newly created Gem Stalker of an appropriate colour. This Gem Stalker remains under your control for the next week, after which it learns the location of the nearest Gem Dragon that matches its type and comes under their control instead. You may only create a Gem Stalker in this way when you have none under your control.

optionalfeature.name: Gem Snack Summoner
entries:
Once per long rest you can cast Summon Beast at a level equal to your proficiency bonus. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell. The type of beast it summons depends on the Gem type you associate with as seen in the Snack Summon table
When you cast the spell in this way it requires no components. If you kill the beast you regain a number of hit points equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus. Once you attack the beast it is no longer an ally and will fight back, but won’t run. 
You may also cast the spell in the regular way with any spell slots you have yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Connection
entries: You can cast any spell you can cast once per long rest because of a racial trait, once per short rest instead.

optionalfeature.name: Gem Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to one of the following pairs of damage types: force and psychic, thunder and lightning, psychic and fire, necrotic and acid, or cold and radiant damage. Additionally, whenever someone rolls for damage within 30 feet of you you may use your reaction to change the damage type to one of the ones you gained resistance to from this trait. You may use this reaction a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses at the end of a Long Rest.

optionalfeature.name: Induced Gravity
entries: You gain the benefits of the Slow Orenth trait. Additionally, any creature of your choice within 10 feet of the creature you slowed also has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Friendly Strikes
entries: You gain the benefits of the Sap Orenth trait. Additionally, whenever you hit a creature you may choose to charm them instead. They must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8+your proficiency bonus+your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save they become charmed by you until the start of your next turn. On a successful save nothing happens (and they also don't gain disadvantage on their next attack against you). You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

feature: Exclusive, a Tier 1 Fey Orenth trait.

optionalfeature.name: Ruby Spellcasting
entries: Whenever you use your Gem Spellcasting Orenth trait you may also regain a 2nd level spellslot.

feature: 10+ piety with Sardior and a Gem Spellcasting Orenth trait.

optionalfeature.name: Induced Intoxication
entries: The alcohol finally kicks in. As a bonus action you can gain the following effects. For the next hour, you have disadvantage on Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks and saving throws. Additionally, your current hit points and hit point maximum increase by an amount equal to your level, and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your constitution modifier at the start of each of your turns. It automatically activates when you drop to 0 hit points, but then you can't use it again until the end of your next long rest. You may use this ability once per Short Rest as long as you had alcohol during the short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Iron Skin
entries: Your skin hardens like iron, giving you resistance to bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Grounded
entries: As a reaction you can become immune to lightning damage until the end of your next turn. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses at the end of a Long Rest.

optionalfeature.name: Body Slam
entries: While grappling a creature you may use the creature as a weapon. Your unarmed strikes against other creatures deal an additional 1d4 bludgeoning damage and whenever you hit a creature the creature you are grappling also takes 1d4 bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: It's the little things that count
entries: You may pick 3 tier 1 Orenth traits of any type. These traits count as Ingens Orenth traits for you.

optionalfeature.name: Ooblek Armor
entries: Whenever you take damage you may use your reaction to increase your AC by the number of damage dice dealt until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Constricted Constrict
entries: After you grapple a creature you may attempt to grapple the creature again, restraining the creature on a success. If the creature escapes your grapple the restrained condition also ends.

optionalfeature.name: Rapid Adaptation
entries: As a reaction to taking damage you can become resistant to that damage until the end of your next turn. You may use this reaction a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and regain all uses at the end of a Long Rest

optionalfeature.name: Charge
entries: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Heavy and Reach property. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature before hitting it with an attack with this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d12 damage and must make a Strength saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. On a failure, the target falls prone.

optionalfeature.name: Graze
entries: Choose a melee weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Heavy property. If your attack roll with this weapon misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can’t be increased in any way, other than increasing the ability modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Nick
entries:
Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Light property, your Unarmed Strike if you have the Martial Arts feature or a Double Bladed Scimitar if you have the Revenant Blade Feat. When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can make it as part of the Attack action, instead of as a Bonus Action. You can still make this extra attack only once per turn. 
If you have the Martial Arts feature you can instead make an unarmed strike as part of the action. If you use the Flurry of Blows feature you can spend 1 ki to make an additional unarmed strike as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Push
entries: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Heavy, Two-Handed or Versatile Property. If you hit a creature with this weapon, you may push them up to 10 feet away from you horizontally, if it is no more than one size larger than you.

optionalfeature.name: Topple
entries: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Heavy, Reach or Versatile property. Once per turn when you hit a creature no more than one size larger than you with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a Strength saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. On a failed save, the creature has the Prone condition.

optionalfeature.name: Vex
entries: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Ammunition, Finesse, or Light property. If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Deadliest Weapon
entries: You gain a tier 2 Orenth trait with the Weapon Mastery subtype. Additionally, you may apply two different Orenth traits with the Exclusive prerequisite to the same weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Bounce
entries: You get the benefits of the Push Orenth trait, but instead of pushing the creature, you can decide to push yourself 10 feet in a direction of your choice instead. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Shield and Sword
entries: You get the benefits of the Flex Orenth trait. Additionally, while wearing a shield and using the weapon from your Flex Orenth trait you may add the shield's AC to the damage you deal with your Flex weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Mastered: Graze
entries: Whenever you graze a creature you may apply damage bonuses such as sneak attack, smites and similar abilities that would trigger on a hit.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Mastered: Close Quarters Combat
entries: The extra attack from your Close Quarters Combat Orenth trait no longer requires your bonus action or reaction, but you may still only use them once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Mastered: Charge
entries: You only need to move 10 feet to use your Charge Orenth trait ability and the extra damage you deal increases to 2d12.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Masterded: Nick
entries: Whenever you use your Nick Orenth trait you can make two additional attacks instead of one. However, one of the attacks must deal just the weapon damage with no modifiers applied.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Mastered: Strangle
entries: After you successfully grapple a creature with your Strangle Orenth Trait they gain disadvantage on Constitution saving throws for the next minute.

optionalfeature.name: 1damage1dice
entries: You gain the benefits of the Flex Orenth trait. Additionally, while wielding the weapon with two hands the damage die increases by one.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Mastered: Bloody Wound
entries: The damage die for the bleeding damage becomes1d6. Additionally the DC for the medicine check becomes 8+your proficiency bonus + the ability used for the weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Mixed Human Heritage
entries: You may pick one racial feat for which you don't meet the requirements that gives you an ability score improvement. You don't gain the ability score improvement from the feat.

optionalfeature.name: The Stubbornest
entries: Whenever you fail a saving throw you may choose to succeed it instead. You may use this ability a number of times equal to the amount of Orenth traits you have with stubborn in them and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Adaptive Feats
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest you may choose one feat of your choice and swap it out for a different one. You must meet the requirements for the replacement feat.

optionalfeature.name: Jack
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to ability checks you dont have proficiency in.

optionalfeature.name: Stunning Question
entries: You pose such a profound philosophical question that you stun a creature. Once per Long rest, as an action, you can target a creature that can hear you and that you share a language with. They must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failure, they become stunned for one minute. They may repeat the saving throw at the start of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Endurance Fighting
entries: Whenever you deal damage to a creature, and afterwards the creature has more hit points than you, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Resistance
entries: Any creature of your choice within 15 feet of you shares any resistance you have.

optionalfeature.name: Saving expert
entries: You may get expertise in saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Bronze Saviour
entries: Whenever a creature within 60 feet of you is about to hit a creature other than you, you may use your reaction to protect them before being struck down. You can give them a bonus to their AC equal to your Charisma modifier until the end of your next turn. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Purposeful Knight
entries: You designate a creature that needs to be vanquished as a Bonus Action. Until it is dead or a minute has passed you gain hit points equal to your Charisma modifier at the start of each of your turns you start within 10 feet of them. You may use this ability once per Long Rest.

optionalfeature.name: Platinum Rest
entries: Whenever you take a short rest you may choose two Metallic rest Orenth effects that remain active during your rest.

optionalfeature.name: Frozen Strikes
entries: You get the benefits of the Slow Orenth trait, with the following change: There is no more limit to how much you can decrease a creature's speed.

optionalfeature.name: Exalting Breath
entries: Whenever you use your breath weapon, you may choose any creature in the area that regains hit points equal to the damage dealt, instead of taking damage.

optionalfeature.name: No Escape
entries: As a reaction to a creature leaving your reach you can choose to move with them as far as your movement allows.

optionalfeature.name: Hands of Supreme Healing
entries: You may roll d12s instead of d8s whenever you use your Healing Hands ability. Additionally you can use this trait thrice per short rest instead of once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial Body
entries: You become immune to the effects of curses that can be removed with the remove curse spell.

optionalfeature.name: Metallic Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to fire, cold, lightning, acid or radiant damage. Additionally, whenever you take this type of damage, the creature that dealt the damage takes the same damage.

optionalfeature.name: Shoveling Hands
entries: Like the dragon you take after, you’ve got a knack for digging. You get a burrow speed equal to half your walking speed.

feature: Kobold with ancestry of a dragon that can dig

optionalfeature.name: Flexible Orenth
entries: You may use any ability score to determine your save DC and number of times you can use an orenth trait. You also gain an additional use for any trait that recharges after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Dissuading Words
entries: You gain the benefits of the Sap Orenth trait. Additionally after you hit a creature they also have disadvantage on their next Wisdom Saving Throw.

optionalfeature.name: School Mastered: Enchantment
entries: Creatures no longer have advantage on saving throws against your enchantment spells if you are currently fighting them.

feature: Spell mastery with an Enchantment school spell.

optionalfeature.name: Summer Solstice
entries: The summer solstice marks the longest day of the year, but also the day where the night start to grow longer. Over the course of a round keep track of the total number of hit points that were regained. For the purposes of this trait a round starts after your turn has ended. On your turn, when you deal damage to a creature you may deal additional radiant damage equal to the amount of hit points regained. You may use this trait a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Winter Solstice
entries: The Winter solstice marks the shortest day and longest night of the year, but also the day that the nights start to become shorter again. Over the course of a round keep track of the number of damage dice that were rolled. For the purposes of this trait a round starts after your turn has ended. On your turn, you may use your bonus action to heal a creature within 60 feet of you for a number of hit points equal to that amount. You may use this trait a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Giving Thanks
entries: Whenever another creature gives you hitpoints, you may use your reaction to thank them. Until the end of their next turn they gain advantage on d20 checks. You may use this ability once per short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Golden Recovery
entries: During a short rest you may consume goldpieces to recover a spellslot. The spellslot level is equal to the amount of gold a spellscroll of that level would cost, to a maximum of 5.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Recovery
entries: Choose a tier 1 Orenth trait that gives you a first level spellslot back. You may instead get a third level spellslot back. The orenth type of this trait is the same as the tier 1 trait you choose.  You cannot choose the same tier 1 trait in this way twice.

optionalfeature.name: Watery Dash
entries: You gain the benefits of the Charge Orenth trait. Additionally while wielding this weapon you gain a swimming speed equal to twice your walking speed, but you can only move in a straight line and you get advantage on the attack while underwater.

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Grass
entries: You get the benefits of the Topple Orenth Trait. Additionally, whenever a creature fails the saving throw you may choose to restrain them too as vines sprout from the ground. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn. You may do so a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Beat him up boys
entries: You get the benefits of the Vex Orenth Trait. Additionally, whenever you successfully hit a creature to gain advantage you may choose to give any ally advantage on attack rolls against them until the start of your next turn. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Acidic Vex
entries: You get the benefits of the Vex Orenth trait. Whenever you hit a creature you may forgo the advantage from vex and instead deal an additional 2d4 acid damage when you hit.

optionalfeature.name: Poisonous Graze
entries: You get the benefits of the Graze Orenth trait. The damage you deal with graze is increased by 1d8 poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Cold
entries: As a bonus action you can activate your aura. While your aura is active, any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you becomes slowed. They remain slowed until they end a turn further further than 5 feet away from you. It remains as long as you keep concentrating on it.

optionalfeature.name: Expert Fey Steps
entries: You’ve become an expert at stepping in and out of reality. When you use your bonus action for Fey Steps you gain a teleporting speed equal to your walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Knowing thy Enemy
entries: You may choose an Wood or Gold Orenth Trait of Tier 3 or lower if you meet the prerequisites.

optionalfeature.name: Cold Karst Winds
entries: You may choose a Wind or Silver Orenth Trait of Tier 3 or lower if you meet the prerequisites for it.

optionalfeature.name: Subtle Magic Master
entries: Whenever you cast a cantrip you may choose to ignore its somatic and verbal components..

optionalfeature.name: Volcanic Adaptation
entries: You may choose a Fire or Brass Orenth Trait of Tier 3 or lower if you meet the prerequisites for it.

optionalfeature.name: Sapphire Cytosis
entries: You may choose a Lightning or Copper Orenth Trait of Tier 3 or lower if you meet the prerequisites.

optionalfeature.name: Seaside Dragon
entries: You may choose a Water or Bronze Orenth Trait of Tier 3 or lower if you meet the prerequisites.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Topple
entries: You gain the benefits of the Topple Orenth trait, however, the target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw instead.

optionalfeature.name: Illusory Graze
entries: You gain the benefits of the Graze Orenth trait. However, whenever you miss a creature they take psychic damage equal to the ability modifier you used for the attack roll plus your Intelligence modifier instead.

optionalfeature.name: Telekinetic Weapon
entries: You gain the benefits of the Nick Orenth trait. Additionally, the weapon that has Nick applied to it, no longer requires a free hand to wield.

optionalfeature.name: Big Skin
entries: Your skin hardens like Big, giving you resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Acquired Immunity
entries: When you take damage you may reduce the damage by 1. The damage reduction increases by 1 every subsequent time you take damage. The damage reduction returns to 1 when you don't take damage for an entire round.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Mastered: Topple
entries: Whenever a creature fails the saving throw against your Topple Orenth Trait, their speed is reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Mastered: Flex
entries: Whenever you hit with the weapon that your Flex Orenth trait applies to, you may roll the damage die twice.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Mastered: Sap
entries: You get the benefits of the Sap Orenth trait, but the creature gains disadvantage on all attacks before the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Mastered: Slow
entries: Whenever you hit a creature their speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Mastered: Deflective Weapons
entries: The amount of dice you roll when you use your Deflective Weapons Orenth trait doubles. Additionally the armour class increase lasts until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Distracting Mockery
entries: Whenever a creature uses a reaction within 30 feet of you, you may use your reaction to force them to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8+ your prof. bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failure they take 1d4 psychic damage and lose their reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Inspired Vex
entries: You gain the benefits of the Vex Orenth trait. Additionally, whenever you hit a creature you may also choose to give an ally advantage on their next attack they make against the creature before the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Living Legend
entries: Stories have been spread about your great deeds and the people's belief in you bolsters you. You may use your Charisma modifier instead of your Constitution for calculating your hp.

optionalfeature.name: Formidable Recovery
entries: Choose a tier 1 Orenth trait that gives you a first level spellslot back. You may instead get a fourth level spellslot back. The orenth type of this trait is the same as the tier 1 trait you choose.  You cannot choose the same tier 1 trait in this way twice.

optionalfeature.name: Animating Breaths
entries: Instead of using your Breath Weapon, you may instead spend 4 uses of it to summon an Animated Breath (FTD) related to your Chromatic ancestry. The Animated Breath is under your control and you can command it (no action required). It remains for 10 minutes.

optionalfeature.name: Ruthless Fire
entries: You gain the benefits of the Graze Orenth trait. Additionally, before you attack a creature you may reduce your hit bonus by a value of your choosing. If you hit you deal twice this value in fire damage to the target.

optionalfeature.name: Master Fey Steps
entries: You have mastered your Fey Steps Feature. You get a teleport speed equal to your walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Photosynthesis
entries: Your Photosynthesis Trait functions whenever you are in bright light.

optionalfeature.name: Slowed Time Strikes
entries: You gain the benefits of the Slow Orenth trait. However, instead of reducing their speed by 10 feet you may instead choose to give them the Dazed condition.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Mastered: Vex
entries: After you use your Vex Orenth Trait you can choose to make an additional attack against them instead of gaining advantage. You may do so once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Turtle Speed
entries: You gain the benefits of the Slow Orenth trait. However, instead of reducing their speed by 10 feet you may instead choose to give them the Slowed condition.

optionalfeature.name: Human Variety
entries: The variety of humans leads to them being able to accomplish extraordinary feats. You gain a feat.

optionalfeature.name: School Mastered: Evocation
entries: You may downcast any Evocation spell that can be upcast of 2nd level or higher. When you do so reduce the number of damage dice in the same pattern as it gets increased for higher level spellslots.

feature: Spell mastery with an Evocation school spell.

optionalfeature.name: Mighty Recovery
entries: Choose a tier 1 Orenth trait that gives you a first level spellslot back. You may instead get a fith level spellslot back. The orenth type of this trait is the same as the tier 1 trait you choose.  You cannot choose the same tier 1 trait in this way twice.

optionalfeature.name: Chaotic Recovery
entries: Whenever you cast a first level spell roll 1d4. If you roll a 1 you do not expend a spellslot and you must roll on the wild magic table.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Rebuttal
entries: You gain the benefits of the Lock Blades Orenth trait. Additionally, whenever you beat the attacker's attack roll by more than 5 you may deal damage to them equal to the ability score modifier used to parry the attack. The damage type is that of your weapon.
